overview_of_class: This course surveys various forms of music that are indigenous to the music culture of Chicago, such as jazz, blues, gypsy, Irish and klezmer music. By combining interviews, recordings, films and performance, this course connects the student with the neighborhoods and culture that brought these forms of music to Chicago. Presented in a five-week format, this course meets for five Saturdays from 9:00 am to 4:00 pm: 1/9, 1/16, 1/23, 1/30, 2/6. First class attendance is mandatory.
name: Selected Topics in Music
title: SCS MUS_HIST 335-CN-17 Selected Topics in Music

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course surveys various forms of music that are indigenous to the music culture of Chicago, such as jazz, blues, gypsy, Irish and klezmer music. By combining interviews, recordings, films and performance, this course connects the student with the neighborhoods and culture that brought these forms of music to Chicago. Presented in a five-week format, this course meets for five Saturdays from 9:00 am to 4:00 pm: 1/9, 1/16, 1/23, 1/30, 2/6. First class attendance is mandatory.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: No prerequisites or musical training are needed for successful completion of this course.

subject: MUS_HIST
